context: Discussing how to scale Studio Shade Co beyond $100K MRR
quote: You're not in the window shade business. You're in the trust business. Shades are just the proof.
insight: Reframed my entire approach. Stopped competing on price, started selling certainty. Homeowners don't want shades - they want to trust the person touching their $2M home.
applicationPlan: 1. Rebuild sales script around trust signals. 2. Add more testimonials to site. 3. Offer 'meet the installer' calls. 4. Create 'insurance + bonding' one-pager.
applicationResult: Close rate jumped from 22% to 34% in 2 weeks. Customers stopped price shopping.

quote: The objection isn't the objection. It's a test to see if you believe in what you're selling.
insight: When prospects say 'too expensive,' they're really asking 'why should I trust you?' My job is to stay confident and reframe, not defend the price.
applicationPlan: Practice 'feel-felt-found' framework. When they say expensive: 'I understand how you feel. Others felt the same way. Here's what they found...'
applicationResult: Closed 2 deals this week using this exact framework. Confidence is contagious.

context: Coffee chat about building NOVA Dashboard
quote: Build for yourself first. If it solves your problem, it'll solve someone else's.
insight: Stop worrying about 'is this marketable?' Just build what I need. NOVA Dashboard started as my personal tool - now others are asking for access.
applicationPlan: Finish building NOVA for myself. Document everything. If it works, maybe turn it into a product later. No pressure.
applicationResult: Stopped overthinking. Built 8 tabs in 2 weeks. Feeling energized instead of anxious.
